Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.datastorage

Class XMLDataContainer

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.datastorage.XMLDataContainer
public class XMLDataContainer
extends Object
SubClass of DataContainer which provides all methods for reading and writing from or to Ascii files in XML format, and store the data at runtime within the DataContainer.
Author:
LK Test Solutions
See Also:
DataContainer

  • Constructor Details

    • XMLDataContainer

      public XMLDataContainer​(DataContainer dCont)
      Construct a new specific DataContainer for XML files.
      Parameters:
      dCont - the DataContainer instance to use it in the read and write methods of this specific data container

  • Method Details

    • readData

      public void readData​(Filter filter)
      This method is used to load data from an XML-File to the datacontainer. As the structure of a XML is fundamentally different from the datacontainer instance, only references of the values are stored in the container as "X-Paths". Every XML-Tag has its own column in the container. The references alone are useless, they need to be read out by getValue.
      Parameters:
      filter - Has no effect here.

    • writeData

      public void writeData​(String srcFile)

    • getDecoded

      public String[] getDecoded​(int index)
      This method is used to translate the XPath references to actual values from the XML File. Using the specified index, the according row (element Occurrence) will be read out and fed to a translator method. The output of this method is the return value.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the returning row.
      Returns:
      an array with all translated references (values) of the row.

    • getAttributes

      public String[] getAttributes​(String expr, String attrName)
      Searches for all tags defined by parameter expr and retrieves the values of their attributes defined by attrName.
      If expr includes the tag with full xPath, then the scope of the search will be the parent xPath of the tag (e.g. /Rules/rule/regExpr only searches in /Rules/rule).
      If expr only includes a tagname, the scope of the search will be the whole document. In this case all tags that match to expr will be searched.
      Parameters:
      expr - Name or full XPath of XML tags
      attrName - Name of the XML tags attribute from which the values will be returned

    • getColumn
